problem_text: This is a GeomVerse problem. If the ABCD shape is a combination of a rectangle and a semi-circle, the perimeter of the ABCD shape is 60 and the area of the BFGC square is 64, compute the length of the AB side of the ABCD shape. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as patches
import numpy as np

# Coordinates
A = (34.23, 34.23)
B = (34.23, 19751.039999999997)
C = (8034.23, 19751.039999999997)
D = (8034.23, 34.23)
F = (34.23, 27751.039999999997)
G = (8034.23, 27751.039999999997)

# Create figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(6, 18))

# Draw the lime rectangle (A, B, C, D)
lime_rectangle = patches.Polygon([A, B, C, D], closed=True, color="lime", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(lime_rectangle)

# Draw the lime semicircle at the bottom
arc_center = ((A[0] + D[0]) / 2, A[1])
arc_radius = 4034.23
arc = patches.Wedge(arc_center, arc_radius, theta1=0, theta2=180, color="lime", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(arc)

# Draw the brown rectangle (B, F, G, C)
brown_rectangle = patches.Polygon([B, F, G, C], closed=True, color="brown", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(brown_rectangle)

# Draw right-angle markers
def draw_right_angle(ax, p1, p2, p3, size=0.5, color="gray", alpha=0.8):
    '''Draw a right-angle marker at the corner defined by p1, p2, and p3.'''
    v1 = np.array(p1) - np.array(p2)
    v2 = np.array(p3) - np.array(p2)
    v1 = v1 / np.linalg.norm(v1) * size
    v2 = v2 / np.linalg.norm(v2) * size
    marker = patches.Polygon(
        [p2, p2 + v1, p2 + v1 + v2, p2 + v2],
        closed=True,
        facecolor=color,
        edgecolor=None,
        alpha=alpha
    )
    ax.add_patch(marker)

# Add right-angle markers
draw_right_angle(ax, A, B, C)
draw_right_angle(ax, B, F, G)
draw_right_angle(ax, F, G, C)
draw_right_angle(ax, G, C, B)
draw_right_angle(ax, C, B, F)

# Add labels
ax.text(A[0], A[1], "A", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(B[0], B[1], "B", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(C[0], C[1], "C", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")
ax.text(D[0], D[1], "D", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="top")
ax.text(F[0], F[1], "F", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(G[0], G[1], "G", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")

# Configure the plot
ax.set_xlim(-4965.77, 13034.23)
ax.set_ylim(-4965.77, 35034.23)
ax.set_aspect("equal")
ax.axis("off")

# Show the plot
plt.show()

ext_info.cot: The area of the BFGC square is 64, so the length of the BC side is $\sqrt{64} = 8$. The perimeter of the ABCD shape is 60 and the length of the BC side is 8, so $2 * OtherSide + 8 + \frac{8 * 3.14}{2} = 60$. So $2 * OtherSide = 60 - 8 - \frac{8 * 3.14}{2} = 60 - 8 - \frac{25.12}{2} = 60 - 8 - 12.56 = 39.44$. Therefore, the length of the AB side is $\frac{39.44}{2} = 19.72$. Therefore the final answer is 19.72.
